intro: Arabis shengkuangshanensis, commonly known as the Shengkuangshan rockcress, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The species is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
